Package fast3d.util.serial

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BinaryReader
    a simple way of reading complex primitive information out of a binary stream
    the backing stream needs to be opened and closed separately - this instance can just be collected by the JVM garbage collector
    every IO-Exception will be caught and it's stack trace is printed
    BinaryWriter
    a simple way of writing complex primitive information into a binary stream
    the backing stream needs to be opened and closed separately - this instance can just be collected by the JVM garbage collector
    every IO-Exception will be caught and it's stack trace is printed
    F3ObjExporter
    the counterpart to fast3d.util.serial.F3ObjImporter to shrink file sizes of .obj-files
    F3ObjImporter
    a loader for the fast3d-format *.f3obj - a binary compressed version of Wavefront object *.obj
    in advance to .obj the fast3d-obj-format will make up to 90% data-compression
    Just call loadSave() and then take the loaded scene from the "scene" field - the result value will tell you the success.
    MtlLibLoader
    to load an *.obj file it is necessary to declare the used coloring-data as materials in a separate file
    ObjFileLoader
    loads an *.obj-file
    the filename does not have to end with *.obj / *.mtl, just the files content matters
    every "g"-tag will create a new fast3d.complex.Group and every "o"-tag will create a new fast3d.complex.Object
    every Group will be packed to the previously declared Object, every Object will be packed to one fast3d.complex.Scene
    the first undeclared group and object are called as the content of the unnamed field (should only be changed for good reason)
    VecBinaryReader
    providing the possibility to read vectors
    can be treated as a BinaryWriter
    VecBinaryWriter
    providing the possibility to write vectors
    can be treated as a BinaryWriter
